alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:42PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cochise County through 1045 PM MST... At 941 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles south of Pearce-Sunsites to 9 miles northwest of Bisbee-Douglas Airport to near Naco. Movement was east at 15 TO 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Bisbee, Naco, Bisbee-Douglas Airport, Pirtleville, Elfrida, McNeal and Rucker Canyon. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 340 and 399. Route 92 between mile markers 346 and 355. Route 191 between mile markers 1 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
